scenario_text.value: Why am I remembering that now?
Aoi? Are you okay? Your face looks pale...
I’m...fine.

If you say so. But you haven’t slept after
walking all night in the forest...

(That’s true... Time feels a little strange
right now.)

(It feels like only moments ago I was in the
library.)

(Why was I walking out here in the first
place...?)

Maybe we should go back to the others.
They’re probably worried.
The others...?

Yes, the others! Takuma, Minoru, Kaito,
and Miu! And the professor!
I bet they’re waiting anxiously for you.

Do you know how worried I was when you
disappeared from the library?
And what about...Saki?
Huh...?

(What am I saying? Why did Saki pop into my
head?)

(Oh, now I remember... Saki died, and I felt
so sad, so much regret...)

(I saw her at the library... But then she
disappeared again.)

(No! That wasn’t the real Saki... But it’s
still true that I failed to save her.)

(Saki is gone because of me. That’s why I’m
out here...)

I can’t bear to see everyone now. Not like
this.
Why would you say that?
(Even Labramon doesn’t really...)

(No. Labramon cares about me. I know that
much.)

(That’s why Labramon came looking for me.
I can’t reject that kindness.)
(Hm... But then what about Saki?)

(Saki let go of my hand. She rejected me...
...and my feelings.)
Listen, Aoi. I know you’re sad about Saki.

But you can’t keep it all pent up inside.
Tell me what you’re feeling...
What I’m feeling...?

Yes. Tell me what’s bothering you, what
hurts, what makes you sad... Everything.

(No... No. If I’d saved Saki, none of this
would be happening...)

I don’t want to burden my teacher and
classmates with my personal feelings.

Your teacher and classmates? What are you
talking about, Aoi?

Now I understand. I was able to protect them
by keeping everything bottled up inside...
(But that didn’t protect Saki...)

(Because I’m weak. I held back too much from
her.)

(Because I was the same old me. I was the me
from before, from our world...)

Now it’s finally time for me to graduate.
I won’t make the same mistake twice.
Um, Aoi...?

I’m done with holding back. That won’t help
me protect the others.

Yes... I should’ve been more assertive, from
the very beginning.

We all should’ve been more understanding,
helped each other more...
Then we would’ve been able to save Saki!
Aoi! What are you talking about?
A way to save us all.

I wasn’t wrong... Harmony and cooperation ARE
the most important things!

If everyone felt the same as me, there’d be
no more fighting... No more death.

I just want a world where everyone works
together. A calm, and peaceful world.
Are you sure you’re okay, Aoi?

(I just need everyone to understand exactly
how I feel.)
(We must all...become one.)

(I was wrong to reject the idea of group
harmony. That’s why Saki had to die.)

(The only way to prevent that...is for
everyone to be the same as me.)
